pageContext.description: Two rivet holes (broken), clearly visible, but can have had five, or three. Hilt plate damaged, also edges & point.
pageContext.publications: Evan's A.B.I. p. 274 possibly halberd (see below), B.A.V. Trump, P.P.S. 1962, No. 5, p. 98, 223
pageContext.collection: Trump's Dec. W., British Museum W.G. 2064
pageContext.toSearch: Ford, Berwick-upon-tweed, Northumberland Td15, United Kingdom
pageContext.remarks: Almost OK, Is rather dagger or short dirk than halberd, for which neither the rivet plan, the mid rib lines, nor the blade's v. slight asymetry seem suitable. Not listed as halberd by O'[...], Archaeologia 86 (1937) 195-321.
